column4: My 802.11g PCI wireless adapter on linux i386 requires ndiswrapper to use a Win32 driver; am I without recourse for using the same hardware on linux amd64?
if theres not a 32 bit kernel module that supports your hardware without ndiswrapper it's doubtful theres a 64 bit one
and you're saying then that no one's done a 64 bit ndiswrapper to support windows 64 bit drivers
so how would I go about discovering one or confirming it doesn't exist?
whats the chipset in  your wireless card
it's a Marvell chip, let me see
that's harder to keep control of
gnome.org or whatever...i'm sure they have a git repo pull it into your home dir and install the same repo in both ... done
that also doesn't get at the core of the matter, which is that different distros all using same release of GNOME may still have different ideas how they want default settings to be
make them read only after you set the settings how you want
that would probably help, once I figure out how to restore things to how they were xD
and the .files are there FOR YOUR SETTINGS if somethings overwriting them it's a trash program anyway don't use it
